fields.summary: Scroll not working correctly in master-detail, only smooth through the scrollbar

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
This was originally a bug about the scroll event not getting propagated to the window for browser scroll when the grid has scrolled to the bottom. The proper way to solve this would be to move away from the hacked mouseWheelScrollListener and instead move towards true scrolling on the pinned sections. This would be achieved by hiding the scrollbar only (not possible in IE, but possible to set width on scroll on all other browsers to 0px). So to fix this, feature enhancement - put true scrolling on pinned sections, just hide the scrollbars. ================ old JIRA description below ================ When you mouse wheel, the grid consumes the event, so the default window scrolling doesn't happen. Steps to reproduce ag-grid-docs/src/javascript-grid-pinning/examplePinned.html
ag-grid-docs/src/javascript-grid-pinning/examplePinned.js var columnDefs = [ {headerName: "Athlete", field: "athlete", width: 150, pinned: 'left'}, {headerName: "Age", field: "age", width: 90}, {headerName: "Country", field: "country", width: 120}, {headerName: "Year", field: "year", width: 90}, {headerName: "Date", field: "date", width: 110}, {headerName: "Sport", field: "sport", width: 110}, {headerName: "Gold", field: "gold", width: 100}, {headerName: "Silver", field: "silver", width: 100}, {headerName: "Bronze", field: "bronze", width: 100}, {headerName: "Total", field: "total", width: 100} ]; Now you'll be able to scroll up/down on the right (non pinned side of things), but not when over the pinned column
fields.summary: Change scrolling for pinned and master/detail to use native scrolling, not the mimicked version.

fields.description:
See http://plnkr.co/edit/9pyyGuvIFctG7vwEYMHt?p=preview

If you edit the mood column (scroll right) then up/down will be output in the console, but home/page up/down will be ignored

We should allow the user to ignore all keyboard events I think.

Niall Note - the page up / down keys are not cell events - they are grid panel events - that is why they are not provided as part of this callback. To implement this, would need to reconsider the design, so the grid panel keys somehow also call this - which is a bit tricky, as the grid panel doesn't necessarily have an associated colDef.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
I made this simple repo to show the issue: https://github.com/alanasim/ag-grid-w-react-redux-example/

If you run that example and try to copy and paste a 4x10 or larger area of the grid you can already see there's a bit of a delay even with not much going on. The lag increases with larger paste areas, and with more derivations / visual updates as in our use case things got pretty slow even with small areas.

With the Redux action hooked in to update based on cellValueChanged it seems to draw out the clipboardService function and the multipleCellRange function runs multiple times according to Chrome performance panel (I'm using Chrome 60 btw).

An "all done" event or "paste started" + "paste stopped" or some type of flag on cellValueChanged to say it was from a paste could all be helpful. It would be ideal to still be able to use cellValueChanged for single-cell updates, but there is currently no way I could see to conditionally ignore that event if it was from a paste. I switched to listening for cellEditingStopped for non-paste updates and cellsFlashed to do a single bulk Redux update after ag-Grid handled the paste internally.

from: Alana Simoncelli @  Chronograph.pe

fields.description:
https://ag-grid.com/forum/showthread.php?tid=5373

from the user:

"Most grids that i have used in the passed have an option for sticky groups. So when you group by a certain column and start scrolling the group header sticks to the top of the grid until the next group is hit.

This is extremely helpful for our users when each group contains thousands of records (so they dont get lost).

Any chance this could be considered?

You can check Devexpress or Kendo UI for sticky group examples (they do it well)"

fields.description:
Raised by Sophia:

sophialazarova [8:46 AM] 
I have smth for you guys! I consider this to be a bug or at least inconsistent behavior. For example, we group by "country" by dragging the country column to the top, we can see that the entries are grouped by country and the "country" field disappears from the child entries since it becomes the name of the group. However, when we decide to group again by country but by clicking the context menu of the "country" column and choosing "group by country", the "country" field doesn't disappear from the child entries and it's visible both as group name and as field for every child.


[8:46] 
http://recordit.co/89jmd4QxyK

fields.description:
To recreate:

1) Edit main demo, set 'applyButton=true' for country filter.
2) Open main demo, open up country filter and change it but to NOT hit apply.
3) Go to console and enter "gridOptions.api.getFilterModel();"

Expected: No filter should be returned (as 'Apply' not pressed)
Actual: The intermediate filter state is returned.

Niall Note: the plan is to have tabs in the panel, first tab as it is now, next tab is filters, third tab can be user tab. then also add a button to close it, and then when it's close, the button is in the sidebar to be opened, like in intellij.

fields.description:
*Current behavior*
Currently, when exporting data as CSV, any data that is filtered out is not exported, even when only onlySelected is set to true. This may be confusing to the user.

*Expected behavior*
Even though a row is selected but filtered out, it is still selected and a user would expect it to be exported.

Ideally there would be an onlyFiltered param for Data Export that you could set to false in order to export all rows, even those that are filtered.

See Github post for more info: https://github.com/ceolter/ag-grid/issues/1499
fields.summary: [export] Data Export - Allow export to ignore filtered out rows

fields.description:
This is how Excel and Google Sheets work. From the ticket:

Copy contents of A1, B1, C1 
Highlight cells A2, B2, C2, A3, B3, C3, A4, B4, C4 
Paste contents onto A2, B2, C2, A3, B3, C3, A4, B4, C4 only succeeds in pasting the cells into A2, B2, C2. The rest are left the same. Is there a way to set it up so it pastes to all the rows that are highlighted?
fields.summary: Fill in the selection with the clipboard contents when pasting.
